short_summary: Purchase of an inspection service for the main rotating electrical propulsion machineries for the 3 Medium Icebreaking Vessels (1200) of the Canadian Coast Guard.
description: The procurement will be done through a competitive process with purchases via discovery or tendering. The contract value is expected to be below $1.5 million and it will cover a period of 12 months.
full_summary:
**Tender Announcement**
*******************************************

**Title/Title:** 
Inspection of Propulsion Alternators and Motors

**Reference Number/Numéro de Référence:** WS4157313447

**Publication Date/Datum de Publication:** August 21, 2023

**Tender Closing Date/Date Limite:** September 7, 2023, 14:00

**Government of Canada Contracting Authority:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)

**Description of Contract:**
This contract is for the inspection of the main rotating electrical propulsion machineries for three medium icebreaking vessels of the Canadian Coast Guard.

**Scope of Work:**
The successful contractor will be responsible for:

- Inspecting the propulsion alternators and motors of the vessels
- Providing a detailed report of the inspections
- Meeting all relevant regulations and standards

**Tender Information:**
The procurement method is competitive open bidding. The selection criteria is the lowest price. Trade agreements include the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement.

**Contact Information:**
Ioana Novac, SPAC/PSPC
ioana.novac@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Notice URL:**
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17223930?extsite=MTcyMjM5MzBfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Contract Details:**
The expected contract start date is September 21, 2023, and the expected contract end date is September 30, 2024. 
The contract will be awarded to the successful bidder on the basis of the lowest price. The trade agreements applicable to this contract are not limited and include free trade agreements with Chile, Panama, Korea, Honduras, Colombia, and Canada.
